trans.en: to go, walk, drive etc behind or after someone else

sentences.v: 那些人在跟着我们吗？
sentences.tran: Are those men following us?

sentences.v: 巡逻车跟了那辆宝马几英里，后来就跟丢了。
sentences.tran: The patrol car followed the BMW for a few miles and then lost it.

sentences.v: 汤姆已经去罗马了，他的妻儿很快就会跟着去。
sentences.tran: Tom’s already gone out to Rome and his wife and children will follow shortly.

trans.en: used to talk about how much progress someone makes, or how much effect something has

sentences.v: 他开始解释起来，但没说几句就被玛丽打断了。
sentences.tran: He started to explain, but he didn’t get far (= he did not succeed in saying very much ) before Mary interrupted him.

sentences.v: 许多人认为新的法律力度不够。
sentences.tran: Many people felt that the new law did not go far enough (= did not have a big enough effect, so that more needed to be done ) .
